content.description: Start matched in the hueco.  Traverse the rail. Big move to the lip. Easy topout.
content.location: To locate Whiskey Rail, stand with your back against Fin Arete and look about 30 yards.

content.description: Climb Whiskey Rail to the end of the rail and drop low to connect into Safe Word Whiskey.  Finish on Safe Word Whiskey.
content.protection: Several pads if you want to do this solo as it traverses a lot.   Otherwise just 1 or 2 and have a spotter move it with you.

content.description: Great balancy movement on solid rock around the corner to the left from Israil.
content.location: On the center of the face, step up into a pocket on the face.

content.description: Cool boulder behind Pink Lady/Spectro, with a nice landing. Start sitting on nice jugs, and work up the fragile holds on the arete and face to an airy topout. Will hopefully clean up with use rather than disintegrate.
content.protection: 2 pads, and look out for crumbling holds
content.location: If you stand at Spectro, and look towards Spider Drum, this boulder will be directly to your right. Walk to the lower section of it, towards Spider Drum, and find this arete on the right hand side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start at the left side with hands on both sides of the blunt arete in good pockets. Move straight up on big holds.
content.location: On the Cheap Thrills boulder.  Continue on the trail past The Swan.  Take the left fork down (right leads uphill to Spider Drum).  The Cheap Thrills boulder will be on your right about 50' ahead.  Problems are on the backside away from the trail.

content.description: Sit start double gaston in horseshoe shaped-hueco like hold. work towards the back of you. Throw for lip and top out.
content.protection: crash pad. super low roof so spotters arent really necessary.
content.location: continue past israil, stay to the right, pass spectro. its on the next boulder, kind of on the trail.

content.description: Start on a good pocket. Move right on good pockets on good feet then up through crimps. Easy climbing on fantastic rock leads to more difficult movement near the top.
content.protection: pads and a spotter. the climbing is more difficult near the top.
content.location: The Spiders Drum boulder is up the hill (North-East) from The Swan and Pink-Lady. The climbing is on the North Face of the boulder.

content.description: Very short simple problem. Sit start on jug, work up the route, then big throw for the lip!
content.protection: Crash pad and possible spotters (the throw could swing you off)
content.location: Continue past israil but stay to the right. its right before the swan boulder.

content.description: Climb the big crack and mantel to topout. Says v7 on the guidebook but feels more like a V2?
content.location: Right of Boris

content.description: Sit start with 2-3 finger pocket for left hand and right hand on arete.  Work your way up the arete with some big moves on big holds to a cool top out over the bulge.
content.location:
Just to the right of

Whiskey Rail

, on the northeast corner of the Drunken Knees boulder.

content.description: Great movement on good stone. Does not look like much, but it actually climbs really well.
content.location: Left of the VRG slab around the corner to the left of Israil.

content.description: Sit start to rex arete (left of israil).  Start sitting on underclings, move up the arete on some nice small crimps to join the V3 stand start.  Feet at the start are quite sandy but the quality on the rest of it is really good, and the petrified wood hold on the stand is quite cool.
content.location: Left of Israil, sit start the arete on underclings

content.description: Stand start with right hand in (or next to) petrified pocket and left hand on edge. Go up.
content.location: Just left of Israil.

content.description: Sit start on jug, move left and pull over lip. Top out on arete right of Spectro finish.
content.location: Right of Spectro on Pink Lady boulder.

content.description: Listed as route 31 in the St. Goerge guidebook. Maybe it's been done before? Starthold might break soon.
content.location: Start low on an incut edge under the roof and do two hard moves to gain sloper jugs at head height. Topout right.

content.description: Sit start at the back of the overhang and climb out a series of huecos until you can reach up to a 2 or 3 finger pocket with the right hand. This is followed by a big move to a hard to see edge, and then easier moves to top out.
content.protection: 3 pads. The route covers a modest amount of ground.
content.location: Continue south a couple of hundred yards past Israel. You will come to a cluster of boulders, the first being the very obvious Fin Arete. The Pink Lady boulder is the big boulder just beyond. Pink Lady is to the left of Spectro and climbs out the steep cave.

content.description: Sit start in big pockets on the left arete as for Two Dollar Hooker.  Move up to the large dish.  Traverse right through the hueco and across the lip on slopey crimps.  Top out right on the sloping arete as for Cheap Thrills Direct.
content.location: On the Cheap Thrills boulder.  Continue on the trail past The Swan.  Take the left fork down (right leads uphill to Spider Drum).  The Cheap Thrills boulder will be on your right about 50' ahead.  Problems are on the backside away from the trail.

content.description:
Same start as pink lady, but at the lip start moving right into another finger pocket and continue right along lip on crimps and trailing heel until hard rock over. 20+ moves!

https://vimeo.com/491913740
content.location: Same start as pink lady. Finishes just before his Spectro.

content.description: Crux is pulling the lip with somewhat of a mantle at the end. The rail is not too slopey, but can pose some trouble in warmer conditions.
content.location: The route is on the east side of Israel boulder, the obvious rail. Traversing it left to right from corner to corner completes the problem. The top out is completed using a right hand side-pull and intermediates to bump up to a good positive crimp or jug if you can reach it.

content.description: This variation of Israil starts below the left rail, and moves straight up.
content.location: It is located just south of the Device Ignitor Boulder.  There is a path that will lead you to Israil.

content.description: Start down and right matched on the sloper.  Move left and up using heal hooks until you reach a right handed crimp. Off the crimp you throw to the rail on the other side, and then work your way up.
content.protection: There is a flat landing.  Very safe.
content.location: This boulder is just south of the device ignitor boulder.  You will see a path that leads right to IsRail.

content.description: Awkward Sit start on arete traverse right under lip
content.location: Just left of pink lady

content.description: Pretty fun boulder with a gentle overhang, features some fun crimps/sidepulls.
content.location: On the right side of the Boris boulder (left of pink lady and booka) . Start on  a good low hueco, make a couple moves right then up the face.

content.description: Sit start hands in hueco. move through the giant huecos to the right, possible sloper to top out.
content.location: this is on the same boulder as the swan but on the opposite end. you have to walk past this problem to get to the swan. its right past spectro.

content.description: Awkward variation of The Goose that hooks you in with a confounding sit with your left hand on the chalked pinch jug and your right just above on a grainy crimp and won't let you go until you finish the damn thing. Sort out a left heel and a right toe-hook before you enjoy falling on your ass like a sad ugly duckling till you figure out how to generate enough momentum to reach the bottom of the V4 starting hueco.
content.location: Find The Goose and look down...

content.description:
I did not climb this route, but I supported my wife's send while I worked Boris to the right.

She said:

The first move is the hardest: a very technical crimpy start. As you ascend, the holds get better, but it stays strenuous.
content.location: It is left of Boris, on a large boulder that looks like a shark's fin. Walking from the Teepee boulder, this boulder is past Israil but just before Pink Lady.

content.description: Start on the big Tufa-Flake. Climb to the crescent-moon pocket. build high foot smears and make a precise dynamic move to the slot. mantle.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter. The mantle feels high.
content.location: The Spiders Drum boulder is up the hill (North-East) from The Swan and Pink-Lady. The climbing is on the North Face of the boulder.

content.description: Climb the arete, using the flake for your left hand. See pic. Easy top out. Downclimb the easy face to the right.
content.location: Spider drum boulder. See pic.

content.description:
Sit start left of high value target on nice juggy hueco holds.  Moves straight up to a bad crimp, then leftwards through an undercling and more crimps to the lip, then traverse the lip until you find a nice place to top out.

This line is listed in the guidebook as V7, but the right hand crimp seems to have broken and is now really small.  Now it is quite hard!  Probably very solid V9 or a low end 10, we'll see if consensus trends one way or another.  The movement on this thing is amazing featuring a burly iron cross between two crimps.
content.location: Between sortie de piscine and high value target, starts low on nice juggy holds and trends up and left

content.description:
Great movement on classic Moe's holds. Start sitting on the Boris sit hueco, do the start of Boris sit to the jug. Then, rather than climbing left into Boris, climb right through a couple of super cool crimps to the super cool jug on Sortie. Flows so well.

Please make sure these crimps are dry before you climb on them - they are likely very sensitive to moisture and will break off if they are pulled on when wet.
content.location: Starts same as Boris Sit, which is on the ground, both hands in a hueco. This is below Boris, to the right of The Fin, on the boulder to the left of Pink Lady/Booka^3.

content.description: Sit start same as for Cheap Thrills, under the roof on a good undercling.  Move up to the right hand sidepull and cross to crimps.  Continue up on slopey crimps and top out on the sloping arete.
content.location: On the Cheap Thrills boulder under the short roof.  Continue on the trail past The Swan.  Take the left fork down (right leads uphill to Spider Drum).  The Cheap Thrills boulder will be on your right about 50' ahead.  Problems are on the backside away from the trail.

content.description: Sit start under the small roof on a good undercling.  Pull up to a good right hand sidepull, cross to crimps and traverse left across the lip and into the hueco.  Easy mantle up on the sloped horn.
content.location: On the Cheap Thrills boulder under the short roof.  Continue on the trail past The Swan.  Take the left fork down (right leads uphill to Spider Drum).  The Cheap Thrills boulder will be on your right about 50' ahead.  Problems are on the backside away from the trail.

content.description: Low start to Drunken Knees. Sit start at bottom of boulder and climb into Drunken Knees. Took over 3 minutes from start to finish.
content.location: Backside of boulder from Whiskey Rail.

content.description: Start underneath of Boris on a large pocket. Bump out to the crimps just below the chalky knob where Boris starts and make the crux move to the start of Boris. Finish on Boris.
content.location: Sit start of Boris (V6).

content.description: Boris starts matched on a chalky knob about 3-4 feet off the ground. Follow edges and slopers to top out. From my understanding, the boulder to the left is "off." (It's pretty blank anyways.)
content.location: Boris starts on a chalky knob in an alcove between two boulders. The obvious Fin Arete is to the left. A juggy flake route with a hard mantle is to the right. Walking from the Teepee boulder, this boulder is past Israil but just before Pink Lady.

content.description: The intimidating line on the far left side of the Pink Lady boulder. Works out the left arete on some bad holds and a big move.
content.location: On the Pink Lady boulder, on the far left arete. This is the first line you see on the boulder coming from IsRail.

content.description: Sit start with hands on horizontal crack.  Super awkward first move to 2-finger pocket in the face, then follow vertical crack to arete and easy top out.
content.location:
A few feet left of

The Drum

on Spider Drum boulder

content.description: The Crux is either pulling off the sit start, or moving from the loose block up to the arête. There may be some reachy moves up top for shorter folk. I put a lot of work into the landing so it is pretty good now.
content.protection: Pad it up and best to have a spotter.
content.location: This problem is located on the Gas-hole boulder, it is the arête on the north side. Sit start left hand on side pull, right hand on arête/pinch. Work up to the loose block and then on up the arête. Feel free to use the few crimps on the face. Careful of the barn door effect towards the top; this could be considered a high-ball for moe's (insert joke). Walk off the west side of the boulder.
